clinical_study.brief_title: Maternal Thyroid Function in Early Pregnancy and Their Relationship With Gestational Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: Maternal TSH Level and TPOAb Status in Early Pregnancy and Their Relationship to the Risk of Gestational Diabetes Mellitus

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai First Maternity and Infant Hospital

clinical_study.source: Shanghai First Maternity and Infant Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This study was conducted to analyze the role of TSH level and TPOAb status in early pregnancy and use this information in assessment of the risk of gestational diabetes mellitus at different weeks of gestation when the FT4 level is normal.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 7,729 women with singleton pregnancies who were receiving antenatal care at Shanghai First Maternity and Infant Hospital, Tongji University School of Medicine between December 2012 and March 2014 were included in the study. All these women underwent screening for thyroid function (TSH,FT4 and TPOAb) at the first antenatal visit and a 75 g oral glucose tolerance test at 24-28 weeks of gestation. The correlation between a combination of TSH level and TPOAb status and the risk of gestational diabetes mellitus was analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: 75g oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT) positive or not
